entry.title: SAP S/4HANA 2025 Release New Functions
entry.content:
• LoB Affected:
  • New Functionality Added:
  • Asset Management
  • Consumer Products
  • Cross Applications
  • Defense & Security
  • Finance
  • Insurance
  • Manufacturing
  • Public Sector
  • R+D/Engineering
  • Retail
  • Sales
  • Service
  • Sourcing and Procurement
  • Supply Chain
  • Utilities

Hello Gurus 🙂

Today i want to share with you my quick dive into the SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025, and see what is the most significant new functions added to the newer version exclusively.

Hope this blog be useful for you.

LoB Affected:

  1. Asset Management

  2. Consumer Products

  3. Cross Applications

  4. Defense & Security

  5. Finance

  6. Insurance

  7. Manufacturing

  8. Public Sector

  9. R+D/Engineering

  10. Retail

  11. Sales

  12. Service

  13. Sourcing and Procurement

  14. Supply Chain

  15. Utilities

New Functionality Added:

below table is illustrating what's new of 174 added functionalities per each LoB:

Asset Management

  • Maintenance Management

    1. Harmonized Documents in Maintenance Request Apps: With the Harmonized Document Management (HDM) functionality, you can now harmonize the process of handling attachments across different document management frameworks such as Document Management System (DMS), Generic Object Services (GOS), or Archive Link according to your business requirements.
    2. Recording Cooperation With Other Technicians: With this feature, you can determine that maintenance technicians should only be able to record time for another technician by scanning a QR code presented by that person.
    3. Verification of Maintenance Jobs: With this feature, a maintenance technician who has appropriate authorization, can verify jobs performed by another maintenance technician in the Perform Maintenance Jobs app (F5104A). This way, the maintenance technician who is doing the verification provides a quality check based on the principle of dual control.
    4. QR Code Scan Function for Filters in Find Maintenance Orders App: With this feature, you can fill filter fields in the Find Maintenance Orders (F2175) app by scanning QR codes that contain the corresponding filter values. When you scan a QR code with the scanner in the filter area, the system automatically enters the scanned values into the relevant filter fields and executes the search immediately with the relevant results.
    5. New Filter Parameters for Maintenance Order and Maintenance Notification: This feature enables master data specialists to set up geospatial data on objects based on the phase, subphase, notification and order processing contexts. This will help the maintenance planners, supervisors, and technicians to visualize and manage maintenance activities with greater specificity and accuracy.
    6. Original Final Due Date: With this feature, you can view the original final due date in addition to the previous final due date when the final due date is changed in a maintenance notification or a maintenance order. The original final due date indicates the final due date that was initially determined for a maintenance activity, whereas the previous final due date indicates the final due date before the most recent change. This means that the original value remains visible even when the value is changed several times.
    7. Maintenance Order: Dispatch of Individual Operations: With this feature, you can dispatch operations and suboperations of a maintenance order individually. Previously, this option was only available for additional operations in emergency orders and in the apps for Resource Scheduling.
    8. Billable Maintenance Order: Phase-Based Maintenance Process: With this feature, you can use phase-enabled order types to process billable maintenance orders. However, there are some differences in the approval process for billable orders compared to other order types.
    9. Self-Healing for Partner Inheritance: Partner Inheritance transfers partner functions and details from superior technical objects to child technical objects. Self-healing detects and corrects any inconsistencies, maintaining alignment and data integrity across the technical object hierarchy. This process eliminates manual intervention, reducing administrative overhead and the risk of inconsistencies.

Consumer Products

  • Direct Distribution

    • Last Mile Distribution for Direct Distribution
      • Management of Visit List Schedules: This feature introduces visit list schedules for strategic visit list planning.

Cross Applications

  • Integrated Business Communications

    1. Integrated Business Communications: Enable business users to communicate with customers, suppliers, and service partners through personalized, trackable, and scalable messages leveraging business context. Provide this communication initially through e-mail, with more channels to follow.
    2. Log Extension for Customer/ Supplier EoP Check: This feature enables you to get additional log information on why a certain customer/ supplier couldn't be blocked in the system.
    3. Spool Access Method Q: You can use the access method Q in the SAP spool system to print using print queues.
    4. Flexible Data Provider Integration: With this feature, you can use an external data provider of your choice to search for and populate validated data when creating new business partner records. This saves time when creating and researching new business partners. This function is only available if you have licensed and set up the appropriate external data provider. This feature leverages cloud integration capabilities within the SAP Integration Suite. Pre-generated SAP Cloud Integration content is available for the CDQ data provider from the SAP Business Accelerator Hub. Note: This app is only available for cloud-ready mode.
    5. Data Context in the Extended Framework for Situation Handling: This feature enables you to also use data context in the extended framework for Situation Handling. Data context is business data from business objects involved in a situation instance that can be collected, distributed, and used for advanced analytics. If enabled in a situation type, data context is collected when a situation instance is created, updated, or completed.
    6. Custom SAP Object Types/SAP Object Node Types in Situation Objects: With this feature, you can use custom SAP object types and SAP object node types in situation objects.

Defense & Security

  1. Enhancements for the Critical Equipment: This product feature consists of various enhancements for the critical equipment: Migration for Critical Equipment Dismantling of Critical Equipment Technical Status Aggregation for Multiple Technical Status Profiles.
  2. Remote-to-Remote Server Communication Through the Central System: This feature provides the capability to use the central system to communicate from one remote server to another remote server in the same distributed landscape and then re-distribute the data. This supports the process of relocating technical objects and forwarding the notifications and work orders, assuring consistent data in the system landscape while operating at a remote site working offline in a communication-challenged environment.

Finance

  • Accounting and Financial Close

    • Closing Operations (SAP S/4HANA)
      1. Ad Hoc Set and Item in Selections: With this feature, you can use Ad Hoc Sets and Ad Hoc Items as dimensions in selections and validation rules.
    • Corporate Close (SAP S/4HANA)
      1. Additional Fields for Greenhouse Gas: With this feature you can activate a business function that enables you to process additional fields for greenhouse gas in group reporting.
      2. Additional Fields for Public Sector: With this feature you can activate a business function that enables you to process additional fields from the public sector industries in group reporting.
      3. Additional Fields for Financial Services: With this feature you can activate a business function that enables you to process additional fields from the financial services (FS) industries in group reporting.
      4. Display Master Data Change Log for FS Item: In the Define Financial Statement Items app, you can display a change log which shows all the changes that were done for a financial statement item (FS item).
      5. Release Universal Journal: Support of Prior Periods Mode: The release universal journal task now supports two prior periods modes for the accounting integration with group reporting preparation ledger: One for complete data in prior periods and one for delta data in prior periods.
      6. Cross-Version Balance Validation: With this feature, you can define validation rules that can compare figures between two consolidation versions, for example, Actuals vs Budget.
      7. Overwrite Rule Control Level for Balance Validation: With this feature, you can change the message type from Error to Warning for the balance validation tasks with task category Balance Validation in Accounting in the Define Balance Validation Tasks configuration activity.
      8. Activity-Based Consolidation of Investments: Change of Parent: When you change the parent unit in a consolidation group, the task for activity-based consolidation of investments now automatically posts the required entries. It adjusts the cumulative values of the balance sheet for all consolidation units of the consolidation group without an effect on earnings.
      9. Activity-Based Consolidation of Investments: Distribution of Dividends: When a distribution of dividends is reported, the consolidation process should proceed with the intercompany elimination of the dividends as well as the adjustment of the non-controlling interest (NCI). The intercompany elimination is done by the reclassification task. As of this release, you can report the dividend of an investee on dedicated FS items and the activity 18 (Distribution of Dividends). The C/I task supports the corresponding NCI adjustment based on corresponding reported data and the intercompany elimination result.
    • Financial Accounting (SAP S/4HANA)
      1. AVL Version 2 for Accounting View of Logistics Information
      2. Print/Email Payment Advice with SAP S/4HANA Output Management: This feature enables you to print or email payment advice with SAP S/4HANA Output Management.
    • General Ledger (SAP S/4HANA)
      1. Calculation of Key Figures: With this feature, you can calculate the following additional key figures using the Calculate Key Figures (GADBKFC) report
      2. Depreciation Area for IFX and FAR: With this feature, you can specify depreciation area as an additional selection criteria while executing the following MCA processes: Currency Reclassification (IFX) Restatement (FAR)
    • Revenue and Cost Accounting (SAP S/4HANA)
      1. Fulfillment by External Percentage of Completion: You can fulfill relevant performance obligations (POBs) by the percentage of completion (PoC). In the past, this kind of fulfillment was enabled as manual fulfillment only. Now, a new event type is available for the fulfillment of PoC-based POBs: Event Type = PX (Fulfillment by External PoC). To fulfill POBs with this event type, the sender component must calculate the PoC progress and send a fulfillment revenue accounting item (RAI) with fulfillment information to Revenue Accounting and Reporting (RAR).
      2. Enhancement of the "Reprocess Account Determination" Report: The report Reprocess Account Determination (FARR_REPROCESS_ACCOUNTS) has been enhanced to support more selection fields. Up to now, the selection was made solely by using the revenue accounting contract as a mandatory field. With this enhancement, you can select the following main fields: Revenue Contract Company Code Accounting Principle You need to enter a value in at least one of these fields. Additionally, you can restrict your selection by using the fields Created By, Created On, Last Changed By, and Last Changed On, as well as by excluding completed contracts.
      3. Reference Group ID for Performance Obligations with Start Date Type 4: When fulfillments for performance obligations (POBs) with start date type 4 are canceled (for example, through a partial or full return), a cancellation fulfillment is created. For these cancellation fulfillments, the reference group ID is now stored in the fulfillment database table FARR_D_FULFILLMT. This enhancement allows you to easily identify which fulfillment has been canceled.
      4. Fulfillment by Customer-Specific Event Type: You can fulfill performance obligations (POBs) with a customer-defined fulfillment event type if the event types provided by SAP standard are not sufficient for your business scenarios and you would like to enhance them. Depending on the sender component, you need to trigger the creation of a fulfillment revenue accounting item (RAI) by a certain event and provide the corresponding fulfillment event type in the fulfillment RAI.
      5. Support of Cost-Based POC for Execution Order Items with Itemized Billing: This feature enables you to use cost-based percentage of completion (POC) revenue recognition for execution order items with the Itemized Billing billing relevance. The net value of the execution order item determines the planned revenue used in cost-based revenue calculation. The planned cost is the sum of all planned costs from the maintenance orders that are assigned to the execution order item.
      6. Support of the “Revenue-Based Percentage of Completion” Method for Fixed Price Execution Order Items: This feature enables you to use revenue-based percentage of completion (POC) revenue recognition for a) fixed price execution order items (with billing relevance Billing on Completion or Billing via Billing Plan After Release) and for b) not-billing relevant execution order items with price items as subitems. The planned revenue used in revenue-based revenue calculation comes from a) the net value of the execution order item or b) the sum of net values of all price items. The planned cost is the sum of all planned costs from the maintenance orders that are assigned to the execution order item.
    • General
      1. SAP S/4HANA Management Accounting Interface for Central Finance: With this feature you can enable online replication for certain postings from Management Accounting, provided both the source system and the Central Finance system run on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition or SAP S/4HANA 2025 FPS0.
      2. Central Market Segment Reporting: With this feature, you can enable reporting for service documents in your Central Finance system. To do so, the attributed profitability segment from the source system, which includes the service document information, is converted into a real cost object in the posting in the Central Finance System.

  • Billing and Revenue Innovation Management

    • Contract Accounting
      1. Submit to Collection Agency: Automatic Recall by API Collection Agency – Confirmation: You can now process the recall of collection items automatically as part of data receipt by API Collection Agency - Confirmation.
      2. Import of Intraday Bank Statements: Using the Transfer Run for Bank Statements (FPB7P), you can now transfer intraday bank statement data. To do so, schedule transfer runs at the desired time intervals. The system only transfers new bank statement information to payment and return lots automatically.
      3. Tracking Outgoing Payments by Using a Unique End-to-End Transaction Reference (UETR) Carried over SWIFT: You can now include a unique end-to-end transaction reference (UETR) in all payment instruction messages carried over SWIFT. When making an outgoing payment by using the xx_CGI_XML_CT payment medium formats delivered by SAP, the system can add the UETR to your credit transfers, enabling you to track the status of your payments via the Global Payment Innovation (GPI) Tracker.
      4. Display of General Ledger Items Simulated and Posted During Write-Off: Previously, this was only possible for mass write-offs using transaction FP04M.
      5. Collection Strategy Added as Selection Parameter to Dunning Proposal Run: When scheduling a dunning proposal run, you can now specify collection strategies for dunning proposals on the Dunning Parameters tab.
      6. Storage of Payment Card ID in Provider Contract Items: A contract item can reference either a payment card stored in the business partner or a one-time payment card managed by the SAP digital payments add-on. You can now create and modify one-time payment card references, represented by tokens, through the SOAP-based API Provider Contract – Manage or the BAPIs BAPI_CTRACBILLCONTRACT_CREATE and BAPI_CTRACBILLCONTRACT_CHANGE. These tokens are used to identify the cards within the SAP digital payments add-on.
      7. Reversal of Documents with Direct Transfer to G/L: If you post documents in Contract Accounts Receivable and Payable and update the general ledger directly, you can now also transfer the reversal data directly when you reverse the document in the Reverse Documents app.
      8. Contract Data in the Business Partner Financial Overview App: The detail view in the Business Partner Financial Overview app (F2429) now includes contract master data for each business partner.
    • Convergent Invoicing
      1. Decoupling of Print Relevance from Posting Relevance: With this feature, you can define the print relevance of billing document items independently of their posting relevance. This characteristic is passed on to the related invoicing document item. For example, cost postings, which are not relevant for customer invoices, no longer have to be print relevant.
    • Subscription Order Management
      1. Change Process - Change CC Data: The Change CC Data change process enables you to support usage-based scenarios by allowing you to change SAP Convergent Charging (SAP CC) parameters and cross-catalog mapping version in Subscription Order Management. This change process can only be executed using either the Solution Quotation (A2X) or the Subscription Contract Change Process OData API.
      2. Insights Cards Enabled for Subscription Order Management Apps: Insights cards have been enabled for Subscription Order Management apps that now allow you to make on the fly decisions by providing a summarized view of critical business data. The data view is tailored to fit your specific needs and is equipped with contextual navigation to the necessary apps.
      3. Target Quantity in Master Agreement: The master agreement in Subscription Order Management has been enhanced with a target quantity and a released quantity. These fields enable you to perform a partial release of the total quantity of a specific product by defining the target quantity in the master agreement, and consuming part of this quantity in the resultant call-off document. The released quantity is updated in the master agreement based on the ordered quantities in the linked call-off documents.
      4. Rerating of Shared Allowances: The rerating of shared allowances has been enabled in SAP Convergent Charging. To be able to make use of the rerating feature for subscription contracts, the following checks have now been implemented in Subscription Order Management: You must add a business partner to a sharing group. This sharing group can then only be used for this business partner. You can only use a single sharing group ID for all items within a single subscription contract. All products used in a subscription contract must either support rerating or not support rerating. A combination of both is not supported for the rerating feature. You can have only one contributor contract in a sharing group, which is responsible for creating shared allowances. You can, however, have multiple member contracts within a single sharing group.
      5. Subscription with Recurring Delivery of Physical Products: You can now have subscriptions that include the recurring delivery of physical goods or consumables. In such a scenario, the products can be modeled into a bundle or BOM with a subscription product as the main item and the sales items that require recurring delivery as the subitems. In the subscription order or solution quotation, delivery plan lines for the sales items that require recurring delivery can be created based on a delivery frequency and the period. In this scenario the entire product hierarchy including the one-time and recurring sales items are copied to the subscription contact. From the subscription contract based on the delivery plan creation of sales orders are triggered on a periodic basis.

  • Governance, Risk and Compliance for Finance

    • International Trade
      1. Additional Simulation Functionality for AI-Assisted Trade Classification Proposals with Fuzzy Search: With this feature, you can use a new simulation report to schedule the simulation of trade classification proposals with fuzzy search.
      2. New International Trade Compliance Status for Purchase Orders and Purchase Scheduling Agreements: With this feature, a Trade Compliance specialist can check for each product and partner in the purchase order and the purchase scheduling agreement that all legal requirements with regard to Embargo, Sanctioned Party Lists, and Legal Control are fulfilled. This means that dedicated statuses in purchase order documents and purchase scheduling agreements suppress follow-on processes when documents are blocked. In addition, statuses are visible in purchase order documents and purchase scheduling agreements. Note The dedicated statuses for International Trade replace the use of the On Hold status in the purchase order.
      3. Legal Control: Trade Compliance Checks for Regions: With this feature, you - as a trade compliance specialist - can use regions in blocklists, allow lists, and even license-type rules to control shipments to specific regions. Therefore, you can conduct compliance validations to ensure adherence to legal regulations such as export control or embargo.
      4. Support for New Process: Multistage Intercompany Stock Transfer and Sales: This feature enables support for Intrastat in multilevel intercompany stock transfer orders and advanced multilevel and multistage intercompany sales processes. For more information, refer to SAP Notes 3542131 and 3556451 .

  • Receivables Management

    • Settlement Management (SAP S/4HANA)
      1. Harmonized Document Management for Condition Contracts: With Harmonized Document Management (HDM), you can have a harmonized document solution in all SAP S/4HANA apps. HDM has now also been integrated into the Condition Contract (WCOCO) app in Settlement Management for better customer and user experience.

  • Treasury Management

    • Cash and Liquidity Management (SAP S/4HANA)
      1. Situation Template: Balance Threshold Alert for Bank Account: With the new situation template FIN_CLM_BKACCTBAL_THLDEXCEEDED, you can notify bank account supervisors when the balance of a bank account falls short of or exceeds the defined threshold so that the account supervisors can consider taking appropriate actions.
    • Financial Risk Management
      1. Critical Term Match Method Available for Hedge Accounting of Exposure Items: You can now use the critical term match method for prospective effectiveness testing in the Hedge Accounting of Exposure Items process. With the critical term match method, some important business data (the critical terms) of the hedged item and of the hedging instrument are checked as to whether they match. If the critical terms match, it can be assumed that the hedging relationship is effective. The following critical terms can be compared: Nominal​ Currency​ Start date Due date
      2. New Authorization Object for Hedge Management Cockpit: With this feature you can restrict the authorization for the data displayed in the Hedge Management Cockpit via the field 'On Behalf of Company Code' of the new authorization object F_TOE_HMC2 'Hedge Management Cockpit (with On Behalf of Company Code)' in addition to the already available criteria.

Insurance

  1. Collections and Disbursements: For information about new apps, features, and functions in Contract Accounts Receivable and Payable (FI-CA), see the Contract Accounting section under Finance   Billing and Revenue Innovation Management.
  2. Creating Custom Fields: This Customizing activity is relevant if you want to create custom fields using Business Data Toolset (BDT) in Claims Management. Adding custom fields ensures that all necessary claim information is captured efficiently within the system interface. In this Customizing activity you can: Create a new field in the existing screen or section Create a new section
  3. Persistent Financial Overview: With this feature, you can store financial overview data for claims, capturing payment and reserve amounts for reporting and audit purposes. When you activate the flag in ICL_85_FINOVR, the system stores financial overview data in ICLFINOVR database table each time a claim is saved.
  4. OData API: Insurance Claim Financial Overview: With this OData service you can quickly access financial overviews within the Claims Management system. This service allows external systems to access financial data such as reserves, payments, subrogation, and salvage and to retrieve a comprehensive financial overview without manual calculation. You can compare the data over different periods or view the most recent status. This service supports the comparison of financial data across user-defined points in time (PIT), or the retrieval of the latest status of all financial amount fields.
  5. Preliminary Payments: With this feature, you can process the payments for life benefit claims even if the benefit information is not complete in the Policy Management (FS-PM) system. Without this feature, you can process the payments based on the benefit information only, due to the tight integration between the Policy and Claims Management (FS-CM) systems for life benefit claims.
  6. BAdI: Adjustment for Preliminary Payment: With this feature, you can: Create subclaims for coverages that are not yet reflected in the policy Initiate one-time payments Set up periodic payments
  7. BAdI: Mapping to HCM: With this feature, you can automatically map benefit types to wage types based on the configuration in mapping table /GSINS/INH_B2W_C, considering the validity period. This mapping is applied when a payment item is transferred to HCM. You can also override the default mapping by implementing method MAP_WAGETYPE.
  8. OData API: Insurance Claim Negotiation: With this OData service, you can create and update negotiations. You can search for a specific negotiation or request the negotiation data.
  9. OData API: Insurance Claim Litigation

Manufacturing

  • Environment, Health, and Safety

    • Environment Management
      1. Create Permits and Tasks from Reference Documents: With this feature, you can create a permit by uploading a PDF file and copying information directly from the document. Similarly, you can add tasks to a permit by uploading a PDF file and copying the relevant sections into a new task. This feature helps you to streamline the creation of compliance requirements and ensure better accuracy of the input information.
      2. Scheduling Emissions Declarations: With this feature, you can schedule the automatic, recurrent generation of emissions declarations for each reporting period.
      3. Creation of Waste Transfer Requests by Copying: With this feature, you can create new waste transfer requests quickly and easily by copying existing requests and reusing their data.
      4. Enhancements to Waste Transportation Documents: With this feature, enhancements have been made to the My Waste Transportation Documents app, including new and renamed fields.
      5. Printing of Waste Transfer Requests: With this feature, as an Environmental Manager or a Production Operator, you can generate a PDF file of a waste transfer request and print it out. Printing a waste transfer request makes it easier to formally hand over the request, along with the responsibility for the waste, to the person responsible for moving the waste from the point of generation to a storage location or collection point.
      6. Integration of Purchase Orders into Waste Transportation Documents: With this feature, as an Environmental Manager, you can search for and add purchase orders to waste transportation documents in the My Waste Transportation Documents (F5290) app.
      7. Integration of Purchase Orders into Disposal Channels: With this feature, as an Environmental Manager, you can search for and assign existing purchase orders directly to waste disposal channels in the Manage Waste Disposal Channels (F6543) app. This feature helps you better track approved budgets and contracts with business partners for transporting and disposing of waste.
      8. New Type of Waste Transportation Document: With this feature, you can create a new type of waste transportation document. The new Waste Disposal Document (WDD) is a globally applicable solution for generating waste transportation records. It's suitable for cases where there are no specific legal requirements regarding the type of waste being transported or in regions without established regulations for waste transportation.
    • Incident Management
      1. Workplace Safety Overview: Additional Cards, Navigation Options, and Layout Improvements: This update introduces several new features in the Workplace Safety Overview app (F7512): The app now features a flexible layout that allows you to resize and arrange the cards according to your preferences. New cards provide you with additional insights into various aspects of workplace safety at your organization. You can monitor multiple safety metrics in real time, including monthly incidence and frequency rates of injuries and illnesses. New filters let you specify the location and time period that you want to include in the overview. You can navigate to records of incidents, investigations, and electronic submissions in the corresponding apps. You can also open the list of records that match the filter settings on a card by selecting the card's header.
      2. Enablement of RIDDOR-Specific Data Recording: This feature enables you to record specific information needed to report incidents under the Reporting of Injuries, Diseases, and Dangerous Occurrences Regulations (RIDDOR) in the United Kingdom. When you assign the RIDDOR (UK) regulation to an incident, RIDDOR-Specific Details sections are displayed, allowing you to enter additional information relevant to compliant RIDDOR reporting.
      3. Assignment of a Medical Service to an Injury/Illness Log Entry: This feature enables you to assign medical service records from Occupational Health to injury/illness log entries.
    • Management of Change
      1. Location Assignment in Management of Change: This feature enables you to assign locations to change requests to indicate the physical or functional area affected by the proposed change. Each change request must have at least one location assigned (leading location). Locations facilitate effective planning and communication by allowing you to identify all personnel, equipment, and processes involved in the change. Additionally, the Manage Locations app (EHFND_UI_LOC_ENTRY) has been added to the launchpad and enables you to create and edit locations that you can then assign to change requests.
      2. Visualizing and Exporting Change Logs for Change Requests and Activities: This feature enables you to track and visualize historical changes made to change requests and activities, providing a comprehensive audit trail of all modifications.
      3. Configurable Dialog Prompts for Status Changes Requiring Justification: With this feature, you can configure which user status actions or business object actions require users to document the reason for changing the status of a change request or activity. When an action requires justification, a dialog with a text field prompts users to specify the reason for the action. Entering a reason ensures that all changes are properly documented and can be reviewed later if needed, promoting transparency, accountability, and regulatory compliance.
      4. Activity Dependencies in Change Requests: With this feature, you can manage the sequence of change activities to ensure they're completed in a logical order, considering dependencies and priorities. You determine the initial order of activities within a change request by specifying the relevant predecessors of activity templates for each hierarchy level in the Customizing activities Define Activity Templates and Define Change Request Types. You can also adjust and optimize the sequence of activities for individual change requests anytime using the Set Predecessor button in the Edit Change Request and Edit Change Activity apps.

  • Extended Production Engineering and Operations

    • Manufacturing Engineering
      1. Migration of Legacy Routings to Version-Controlled Templates and Rework Routings: A new report MPE_STA_RTG_LGC_TO_TMPL_SFR (Migration of Legacy Routings to Version Templates and Rework Routings) is now available to migrate routings from your legacy MES system to PEO using the features available in the production integration portal (PiP). The report is to be used for a one-time migration process to create version-controlled templates and rework routings from your legacy routing data.
      2. Product Rework: PEO now supports product rework, which is the process of reworking a product at any time after completion of its production order. For example, product rework can be used to implement engineering changes that affect completed production orders, replace defective or degraded components identified for completed orders, or perform repairs or maintenance on products that have been in storage or returned from the field.
      3. Global Alternatives: PEO now supports the use of global alternatives defined using simple discontinuation in the material master record. Components often need to be exchanged, for example, due to defects, stock shortages, or changes in safety requirements. This enhancement gives you more flexibility to replace components in a production order without having to update the BOM. You can exchange a component for a follow-up material that has been defined using simple discontinuation. In such cases, PEO tracks the use of global alternatives in the end-to-end process. PEO also supports the use of global alternatives if you're running PEO side-by-side your ERP system.
      4. Parallel Sequences: With this feature, the use of parallel sequences has been enabled for SAP S/4HANA Manufacturing for production engineering and operations (PEO). A parallel sequence is a sequence of several operations that you can perform at the same time as a number of consecutive operations from a different sequence, which is usually the standard sequence.
      5. Documents for Routing Operations: With this feature, you can assign documents at operation level for a wide variety of routing types. This means that you can now assign important information that is applicable to all the operation activities of a specific operation. In the Perform Operation Activity app, the system displays this document in a dedicated tab for all operation activities of the operation, ensuring that this important information is always available for the production operator.
      6. Extended Quality Check Groups: PEO now supports partial extended quality checks through the assignment of extended quality check (EQC) groups to operation activities and inspection characteristics in the shop floor routing. For example, a partial EQC might be required in the following issues:
      7. Buyoff Qualifications: You can now assign an HR qualification to each buyoff step in an operation activity. This allows you to control who can approve the buyoff steps at production completion. Only a team member with the selected HR qualification can approve a buyoff step.

Public Sector

  1. SAP Ariba Sourcing and Procurement for Public Sector in SAP S/4HANA: The SAP Ariba Sourcing and Procurement for Public Sector in SAP S/4HANA addresses special procurement needs of public sector organizations. The solution offers deep integration with SAP Public Sector Finance and improved efficiency through seamless integration between procurement modules while complying with international procurement policies and public regulations. The solution covers end-to-end public sector procurement process flows within SAP S/4HANA, from requisitioning, e-tendering, source of supply assignment, purchase order and purchase contract creation. Additionally, It provides special support for administrative operations like fiscal year end activities with de-obligation and close-outs or supplier replacements via novation.
  2. Cost Center Universal Allocation with Public Sector Management: This feature enables you to integrate cost center allocations with Funds Management, Grantee Management, and US Federal Accounting. Using Universal Allocation, you can define and run plan and actual cost center allocations including Public Sector Management (PSM) account assignments.
  3. Profit Center Universal Allocation with Public Sector Management: This feature enables you to integrate profit center allocations with Funds Management, Grantee Management and US Federal Accounting. Using Universal Allocation, you can define and run plan and actual profit center allocations including Public Sector Management (PSM) account assignments.
  4. Generate Multi-Year Earmarked Funds Based on Valuation Cash Flow: You can also calculate the interest portion and other conditions that are operating expenses for the first year and thereafter, on an annual basis, by running Generation of Cash Flows for Contracts transaction (RECDCGOL).
  5. Incoming Business Information Exchange Using Shared Accounting Module in US Federal Government: This feature enables you to upload and store Shared Accounting Module (SAM) files with Treasury Account Symbol (TAS), Business Event Type Code (BETC), and valid TAS-BETC combination information. The validation of agency TAS, TAS/BETC, and trading Partner TAS, TAS/BETC occurs during recording of business transactions where account assignment for Fund and Budget Period, if applicable, are entered.
  6. Outgoing Business Information Exchange using Secure Payment System in US Federal Government: This feature enables you to generate the payment disbursement schedule information for domestic wire transfer and instant payments. It includes new Data Medium Exchange file formats and function modules that are available in the SAP Payment Program, using transaction F110, to support domestic wire transfer and instant payment, which are the two new payment methods.
  7. Invoice Processing Platform for US Federal Government: This feature enables federal agencies to securely manage the invoicing process more efficiently, right from Purchase Order (PO) to payment notifications. Invoice Processing Platform (IPP) is a secure, web-based platform that is provided by the U.S. Department of the Treasury's Bureau of the Fiscal Service.

R+D/Engineering

  • Integrated Product Development for Discrete Industries

    • Advanced Variant Configuration
      1. UI Input Control Selection on Characteristic Group Level: This feature enables you to conveniently specify the appearance and use of a characteristic on the evaluation screen. In the Manage Characteristic Groups app, you can select a pre-defined UI input control type for each characteristic. Apart from the 'default' option, which results in the ordinary look and feel, you can make characteristic values selectable with four other UI input control types: radio buttons, dropdowns, checkboxes, and input fields.
      2. Variant Configuration Characteristic Search with Navigation: You can now search for characteristics across characteristic groups and configurable components of the BOM. From the search results, you can navigate directly to a characteristic.
      3. Improved Indicator for Incomplete Characteristics: This feature makes it easier to find unevaluated mandatory characteristics (incomplete characteristics) on the valuation screen. In addition to the general warning that your configuration is incomplete, you can now see orange frames highlighting the incomplete characteristics.
      4. Export BOM Structure: This feature lets you download the Bill of Materials (BOM) hierarchy displayed in the structure panel as spreadsheet file.
      5. Import Sales Document Configuration: With this feature, during a sales document item configuration, you can now import the configuration (user-assigned and external values) of a previous sales document item, so you do not have to enter the values manually.

  • Product Compliance

    • Dangerous Goods Management (SAP S/4HANA)
      1. Introduction of Partially Packaged Dangerous Goods: With this feature, you can set products as partially packaged in the Edit Packaging Details dialog in the Classify Packaged Dangerous Good app.
      2. Printing of Dangerous Goods Freight Documents for Road, Rail, and Ocean Transport: With this features, you can now print dangerous good data on the freight documents for road, rail, and ocean transport in Transportation Management.
      3. Introduction of a Mixed Loading Check for IMDG Code and CFR 49 Regulation: According to dangerous goods regulations, different products may not be transported together in the same transport unit but must be segregated from one another. With this feature, a mixed loading check is provided to verify compliance with the IMDG-Code and the 49 CFR regulation. This check ensures that only products whose mixed loading is permitted under these regulations are transported together.
      4. Integration of the Mixed Loading Check in Value Chain Processes: According to dangerous goods regulations, different products may not be transported together in the same transport unit. To ensure that only products compatible for mixed loading are transported together, a mixed loading check is provided. With this feature, the mixed loading check is integrated into business documents in sales, delivery, and transportation management processes.
    • Product Marketability and Compliance
      1. Tracking of Substance Volumes from Advanced Intercompany Stock Transfer: With this feature, you can track substance volumes that result from transferred stock between different legal entities of a corporate group following the Advanced Intercompany Stock Transfer process. The tracked substance volumes are aggregated for the relevant business process, compliance requirement, and legal entity, and displayed in the Monitor Substance Volumes (F4693) app.
      2. Support for Multi-Component Products: This feature enables you to use multi-component products in your Product Compliance processes. A multi-component product is a collection of multiple products that is considered as one product. This means that you can now better represent how products are sold and used together.
      3. Support for Branded Products: This feature enables the definition and use of branded products. Branded products are derivatives of unpackaged products that reflect under what name a product is later sold. The products are identical but sold under different names, for example, for trademark or marketing reasons.
      4. Notification of Data Readiness for Calculation by Partner Companies: This feature enables you to notify your partner companies that the basic set of compliance data for a compliance view is ready for further processing. This information lets your partners know they can start collecting the necessary data via APIs, calculate the dependent data, and write it back to your system. You can access this feature in the Display Work View app for a product or raw material.

Retail

  1. Display Partially Exploded Orders in Multi Ship-to Order Explosion Report: With this feature, you can use the multi ship-to order explosion report (transaction FSH_MSO) to display only the main multi ship-to order (MSO) documents that are partially exploded during the explosion process.
  2. Report for Posting Tied/Untied Empty Stock Differences: The introduction of the alternate unit of measure Crate (CRT) in counting applications like Count Stock (F1512) and Manage Stock Counting (F8440) can lead to inconsistencies in the stock counting between tied and untied empty products. With this feature, you can use the Posting Tied/Untied Empty Stock Differences (RFM_EMPTIES_PINV_COUNT_DIFFS) report to reconcile discrepancies in the inventory of tied and untied empties, ensuring more accurate stock management.

Sales

  • Order and Contract Management

    • Claims, Returns, and Refund Management
      1. Quality Notification as a Follow-Up Document: When saving a returns order, you can create a quality notification in quality management to trigger a parallel quality management process. The necessary settings for output management using output determination (SD-BF-OC) to create the quality notifications are already maintained.
    • Order Management and Processing
      1. Deletion of Items in Advanced Intercompany Sales and Sell from Stock with Valuated Stock in Transit: With this feature, you can delete items from a standard sales order (2) in Advanced Intercompany Sales and Sell from Stock with Valuated Stock in Transit as long as the delivery has not yet been created.

  • Solution Business Management

    • Solution Quotation Management
      1. Partial Acceptance of Solution Quotations: You can now accept a solution quotation partially if at least one item in the quotation is in Released status. When you choose the Partial Accept button on a solution quotation, a pop-up is displayed showing all items in Released status along with their available quantities for acceptance. You can adjust the quantities as needed. A follow-up transaction is created with the accepted quantity. Partial acceptance can be performed multiple times until all items in the quotation are fully accepted.

Service

  • Service Master Data and Agreement Management

    • Service Contract Management
      1. Situation Template: Trade Compliance Check Blocked/Pending: You can use this situation template to notify your service managers automatically about the service contract items that are blocked by a trade compliance check or for which trade compliance checks are pending.

  • Service Operations and Processes

    • In-House Repair
      1. Situation Template: Inconsistency in Logistics Information for Service Object: You can use the Inconsistency in Logistics Information for Service Object template to inform your service managers that the logistics information originally specified for a service object has changed for the related serialized product or equipment.
      2. Situation Template: Stock Inconsistency for Service Object: You can use the Stock Inconsistency for Service Object template to inform your service managers that the available quantity of a non-serialized product in the specified plant and storage location is less than the quantity originally entered for the related service object. In addition, the stock type and the special stock indicator originally entered for the service object might have changed for the non-serialized product.
      3. Transfer Service Objects to Another Service Center (Intracompany Transfer): Once the service objects have the availability Received by Service Center, you can now transfer them to another service center at which the in-house service is to be performed. You launch this logistics process in the Manage In-House Service Objects (F7695) or Manage In-House Services (F4025) app by creating an outbound delivery. The subsequent process steps that are required to post the service objects to the new service center, are performed in Delivery Management (LE-SHP).
      4. Post Service Objects to Customer Stock: Previously, when launching the returns process for service objects in the Manage In-House Services (F7695) and Manage In-House Service Objects (F4025) apps, the incoming service objects were posted to the sales stock (special stock indicator Orders on Hand / E). You can now post the service objects to the special stock indicator Customer Stock (B), if you've specified this in Customizing.
      5. Specify Plant and Storage Location in Service Objects When Creating Returns Orders: When creating a returns order for service objects in the Manage In-House Services (F7695) and Manage In-House Service Objects (F4025) apps, you can now specify the plant and the storage location to which the service object is posted. If you do not enter a plant and a storage location, the system uses the plant and storage location that have been configured for customer returns.
      6. Receive Service Objects Using Inbound Deliveries: When receiving service objects from customers, you can now launch the logistics process by creating an inbound delivery in the Manage In-House Services (F7695) and Manage In-House Service Objects (F4025) apps. Previously, it was only possible to launch the logistics process using the integration with customer returns.
      7. Search for Note Texts in Service Transactions: It's now possible to use Enterprise Search to search for note texts in service transactions. The feature allows you to quickly find all service transactions that contain a specific note text, such as a problem description in a service order or customer instructions in an in-house service.
    • Service Order Management
      1. Rejection Reasons for Service Transactions: You can now create rejection profiles that contain predefined rejection reasons for service transactions such as service contracts, service quotations, and service orders. This feature enables you to customize your own rejection reasons and group them in a rejection profile according to your business requirements. You can then assign a rejection profile to a service transaction type. With this, when you reject a service transaction or an item in the transaction, you can select from a group of reasons for the rejection.
      2. Support of HDM for Attachments in Service Orders: You can now use Harmonized Document Management (HDM) to manage attachments in service orders. HDM enables the use of Document Management (DMS) that offers enhanced functionality compared to the previously supported Generic Object Services (GOS). DMS allows you to independently search for, access, reuse, rename, and version attachments.
      3. Release Button for Service Orders and Service Order Templates: Previously, you could only set the status of a service order to Released in edit mode and save it manually. Now, you can release a service order in display mode by choosing Release in Manage Service Orders app. With this new button, you can release the service order along with its items in one go, which is less time-consuming.
      4. Facets on Overview Pages of Service Transactions: You can now use facets on overview pages of service quotations, service orders, and service confirmations. The facets provide a structured display of relevant key fields on the header and item levels in a harmonized manner. Using facets allows you to quickly view important data without navigating through the entire object details.
      5. Service Hierarchy in Intercompany Service Process: You can now use the concept of service hierarchy with collective accounting in intercompany service processes. The feature allows you to define intercompany items as main items and subitems in a service hierarchy. Costs incurred by the intercompany service order are collected under the account assignment object of the intercompany item specified as the main item in the service hierarchy.
      6. Planned Cost and Revenue for Unplanned Items: You can now calculate planned cost and revenue – both baseline and ongoing – for unplanned items in a service order. This feature is especially useful if you use the event-based revenue recognition method Recognize Revenue on Cost-Based Percentage of Completion (POC), and the unplanned items are created as subitems of the main item in a service hierarchy.
      7. Multiple Revenue Accounts for Planned Cost and Revenue: Account determination for planned revenue has been enhanced to better support revenue recognition in service orders using the cost-based percentage of completion (POC) method. Previously, only a single revenue account was used for the planned revenue of a service order item, based on its active price condition. Now, it's possible to use multiple revenue accounts, each corresponding to a price condition or discount/surcharge that contributes to the planned revenue. This enhancement ensures that the planned revenue accounts are more closely aligned with actual revenue postings, improving financial accuracy and reporting.
      8. Tool Items in Service Transactions: You can now enter tools for the following service transactions in order to bill them to your customers and to determine and allocate internal costs: Service orders, service order templates, and service quotations (item categories: SRVT, SRTT, SRQT) Service confirmations (item category SVCT).
      9. Editable Fields in Output Control: You can now edit fields under Output Control in service orders, service quotations, service contracts, and solution quotations. Previously, these fields were read-only. This feature allows you to customize output settings for service transactions to meet specific needs, for example, to edit the output queue.
      10. Profit Center Reorganization in Service: This feature supports profit center reorganization in service transactions to align with organizational changes that take place in your company. During the reorganization process, profit centers and/or segments are reassigned and their stocks or balances are reposted to the new organizational entities.
      11. Plant and Storage Location in Service Transactions: The plant and storage location can now be automatically determined and displayed when the service transaction item is entered. You can also manually change the plant and storage location in the Items assignment block. If you manually change the plant and then want to change it back to the original value, you can use the Redetermine Plant/Location button in the Items assignment block.

Sourcing and Procurement

  • Central Procurement

    • Central Purchase Contract Processing
      1. Custom Split Criteria for Central Purchase Contracts: This feature allows you to customize how the Central Purchase Contracts are split and distributed to connected systems based on plant, storage location, and custom fields.
    • Central Purchasing
      1. Addition of New Fields in Purchase Order Extraction: This feature enables you to extract the Shipping Instruction and Price Printout fields from Purchase Orders (PO), both taken from the item-level fields in the PO data.

  • Operational Procurement

    • Purchase Order Processing
      1. Aggregation of Lean Service - Related Purchase Order History Items: This feature enables you to include lean service standard items as well as enhanced limit items in transaction ME87(Summarization and Removal of PO History Records).

  • General

    1. Allow Posting of Non-Valuated Good Receipts to Service Entry Sheets: This feature enables you to allow posting of non-valuated good receipts to Service Entry Sheets (SES).
    2. Service Master Data Migration Report to SAP S/4HANA: This feature enables you to transition from using MM-SRV in SAP S/4HANAto the Lean Service Product model. By running the RMMSRV_SRVMSTR_MIG_TO_S4 report, it converts your existing Service Master Data into the Lean Service Product format. This ensures your data aligns with the structural requirements of the SAP S/4HANA system, making the migration process smooth for our existing customers.
    3. Migration of Service Purchase Orders to Lean Services in SAP S/4HANA: This feature enables you to close existing service-based purchase order (PO) data from legacy tables and create new ones in the Lean format. Lean Services is SAP’s strategic solution for Service Procurement moving forward. While MM-SRV remains available, it will no longer receive functional enhancements.
    4. Migration of Service-Based Purchasing Contracts to Lean Contracts: This feature enables you to migrate service-based purchasing contracts from MM-SRV to Lean Contracts in the SAP S/4HANA system, based on user-defined input. It allows users to choose whether the migrated contracts should be created as hierarchical structures or as flat item lists.
    5. Mapping MM-SRV Document Types to Lean Services: This feature enables you to define a mapping between classic MM-SRV document types and their corresponding Lean Service document types in SAP S/4HANA .
    6. WBS Element Available in Service Entry Sheet Upload Template: This feature enables you to input the WBS Element directly in the Service Entry Sheet (SES) upload template instead of the internal WBS Element ID number.
    7. New Fields for Service Entry Sheet (Lean Services) API: This feature enables you to use the two new service-related fields Budget Period and Grant ID in the Service Entry Sheet (Lean Services) API.
    8. Non-Valuated Goods Receipt Supported in Purchase Requisitions: This feature enables you to define in the purchase requisition (PR) whether the goods receipt (GR) for a service should be non-valuated. The setting is transferred to the purchase order (PO) and determines how the GR is handled when posting the Service Entry Sheet (SES).

Supply Chain

  • Advanced Order Promising

    • Advanced Available to Promise
      1. ATP Categories in Availability Change Log: With this feature, the Availability Change Log (ACL) framework now records the ATP category along with the material, plant, MRP area, date, and time details for selected documents.
      2. Pool Segment as Planning Level in Supply Protection: This feature enables you to use pool segments as an additional planning level in supply protection. This allows the setup of supply protection, for example, for a specific quality grade. In such a case, supply protection could be set up in such a way that the articles with the highest quality are reserved for special protection groups such as key customers, whereas there isn't any restriction in place for lower-quality articles.
      3. Maximum Sequence Number in Alternative Determination: With this feature, you can use a new rating attribute to determine alternative confirmations for a requirement.
      4. With Creation of Stock Transport Document: With this feature, you can simplify logistical processes by triggering the automatic creation of transport orders to move stock from substitute plants or storage locations to the plant or storage location originally requested in an order.
      5. Rounding Confirmations in Sales Documents: With this feature, you can use rounding for confirmed quantities in sales orders and stock transport orders.
      6. Ability to Override Existing Confirmation Constraints: With this feature, users can override any existing Product Availability Check (PAC), Product Allocation (PAL) or Supply Protection (SUP) constraints to allocate confirmation to a requirement.
      7. Optimistic Reservation of Quantity: With this feature, you can configure the type of quantity reservation that is to be applied when the availability for a requested product is checked.
      8. Calculation of Supply and Demand for Subcontracting: With this feature, you can now configure how supply and demand is considered for product availability checks involving subcontracting scenarios.
      9. Batch as Planning Level in Supply Protection: This feature enables you to use batches as an additional planning level in supply protection. This allows for the protection of a specific batch of a vaccine. Batch identification can also be relevant for paints, chemicals, cosmetics, food, etc. In such a case, supply protection can be set up in a way that the quantities of a specific batch are reserved for special protection groups, while there isn't any restriction in place for other batches.
      10. Overprotection Alert in Supply Protection: Use this new standard template (CA_ATP_SUP_OVERPROTECTION) if you want your order fulfillment managers to be informed when the restrictions defined in Supply Protection lead to a critical availability situation when protected quantities are too high. Recipients can get notifications whenever the availability situation in combination with Supply Protection leads to a complete lock, or if single supply protection objects or single protection groups of related supply protection objects are locked.
      11. First Come First Served (FCFS) in Backorder Processing (BOP): With this feature, the system ensures that the availability check gives priority to earlier sales documents and stock transport orders even when later orders are altered.

  • Delivery and Transportation

    • Transportation Management
      1. Ocean Freight Tendering: With this feature, you, as a shipper, can use the direct tendering (non-RFQ) process to send a tendering plan or ocean freight booking directly to the carriers.
      2. Key Performance Indicators in the Transportation Cockpit: With this feature, you can display and evaluate key performance indicators (KPIs) in the transportation cockpit.
      3. Calculation of Distances Traveled with or Without Load: This feature enables you to have visibility regarding distances that are traveled either with or without load and whether the corresponding transportation stages are empty or not. Based on this information, you are able to measure the efficiency of your fleet by calculating the ratio of the distance traveled with load and the total distance, for example.
      4. New Handling Execution Status: Cargo Ready for Loading: With this feature, you can use the handling execution status Cargo Ready for Loading, which, when so customized, starts the creation of customs invoice and export declaration before the goods are loaded onto a truck in an Advanced Shipping and Receiving process.

  • Inventory

    • Extended Service Parts Planning
      1. Assign Location Product-Specific Segmentations (Clusters): With this feature, you can assign location product-specific segmentations (clusters) to parts in the product master data within SAP S/4HANA and use them in the Extended Service Parts Planning processes. Clusters serve to group location products of the same kind. You define a cluster type for the criterion with which the clusters are to be formed.
      2. Consideration of Lead Time Variability in Multistage Safety Stock Calculation: This feature enables you to consider lead time variability measures when running the Multistage Safety Stock PSM service.
      3. Forecast Adjustment: This feature enables you to modify forecast results using a factor or a specific value. If you anticipate an increase or decrease in demand, you can adjust the forecast.
      4. OEM-Managed Inventory: With this feature, you can plan the stock of selected dealers. In this way, you can support these dealers in optimizing their procurement planning and stock situation. Furthermore, these dealers no longer need to order from you actively; as the original equipment manufacturer (OEM) and owner of Extended Service Parts Planning (eSPP), you trigger the transfer of stock to a dealer location for normal replenishment.
      5. Stock Monitoring Demand vs. Stock: This feature enables you to proactively manage inventory by providing timely notifications when stock levels fall below a critical threshold compared to the recent demand history quantity. This is particularly important for industries where maintaining the availability of specialized parts is a significant challenge.
      6. Stock Monitoring Phase-Out Forecast vs. Stock: This feature enables you to effectively manage the availability of End of Production (EOP) parts, supporting compliance with business and legal requirements for Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs). It addresses the challenges faced when suppliers discontinue the supply of EOP parts.

  • Warehousing

    • Warehouse Management
      1. Handling Execution Status: Cargo Ready for Loading: With this feature, you can set the handling execution status of a freight order to Cargo Ready for Loading or Cargo Not Ready for Loading in the Load or Unload Freight Orders app. You can use this feature if you want to conduct customs processes before a truck arrives at your warehouse.
      2. Reverse Goods Receipt after Final Put away for Stock from External Procurement: With this feature, you can also reverse goods receipt for stock from external procurement after final put away.
      3. Batch-Specific Units of Measure in Decentralized EWM: This feature enables you to work with batch-specific units of measure in decentralized Extended Warehouse Management (EWM) based on SAP S/4HANA during inbound, outbound, and internal warehouse processes, for example, physical inventory, warehouse-internal movements, or change posting.

Utilities

  1. New Time-Dependent Attributes for the Point of Delivery: In certain markets, for example in Germany, a point of delivery (referred to as the market location in Germany) can be changed to a “dormant” status. Besides this new status, additional attributes must be also added as time-dependent to the point of delivery.
  2. Setup Date Fields of Utilities Contract: Customizing settings for automatic setup of date fields in Utilities contracts allows users to efficiently manage contract durations, renewal dates, and other scheduling data. This feature is essential for ensuring accurate and streamlined contract management processes with Utilities sales contracts.

entry.title: Enterprise Service Organization: Simplifying Sales Area Assignment to the Service Transactions
entry.content:
The 2025 FPS0 release introduces a new streamlined method for assigning sales areas to the service transaction types in the Enterprise Organizational Model enabled system. This enhancement is particularly beneficial if customers work exclusively with service process without Sales and Distributions.  

Prior to FPS0 2025 release, customers had to create placeholder sales order types to support sales area assignment to the service transactions. This new approach eliminates the need for placeholder sales order type customizations, significantly reduces overhead & maintenance and streamlines the process.  

The proposal for Sales Area is based on the following parameters. 

  • BP/Customer  
  • Common Distribution Channel 
  • Common Division 
  • Combine Sales organization, Distribution Channel, Division   

Pre-requisite Customizing    

Enable Enterprise Organizational Model 

SAP Customizing Implementation Guide -> Service -> Basic Functions -> Enterprise Organizational Management -> Enable Enterprise Organizational Model 

Common Distribution Channel, Common Division  

SAP Customizing Implementation Guide -> Sales and Distribution -> Master Data

Combine Sales organization, Distribution Channel, Division   

SAP Customizing Implementation Guide -> Sales and Distribution -> Sales -> Sales Documents -> Sales Document Header -> Assign Sales Area to Sales Document Types 

On execute of “Assign Sales Area to Sales Document Types” 

 Assign Sales area for Service transactions 

New Customizing node is introduced on service for sales area assignment to service transaction type 

SAP Customizing Implementation Guide -> Service -> Basic Functions -> Enterprise Organizational Management -> Assign Sales Area to Service Transaction Types 

Example: 

Consider BP/Customer (Sold to Party) has been assigned to 2 sales area as below  

Sales org 

Distribution channel 

Division

entry.title: Enterprise Service Organization:​​​ Determination of Service Team via Standard and Custom attributes
entry.content:
In the Enterprise Organizational Model enabled systems, the service team was traditionally determined based on only three standard attributes such as Country, Postal Code, and Enterprise Service Organization. 

However, there are scenarios where it is necessary to include custom attributes also with standard ones to enable more specific service team determination based on transaction-specific parameters. 

With the latest enhancements, it is now possible to determine the service team using both standard and custom attributes defined in the service team responsibility setup. 

To support this enhanced logic, a new BAdI has been introduced: 

BAdI: CRMS4_RM_SRVTEAM_DETERMINATION 

This BAdI enables flexible and enhanced service team determination based on tailored criteria. 

  
How to setup the standard and custom attributes to determine the service team.  

Example objective:  

A specific service team is to be determined when a Service transaction is created for a particular Product as a part of the main reference object. ​ 

This product can be​ 

  • Directly maintained as the main reference object OR​ 
  • Reference Product of the Main reference object Equipment​ OR 
  • Product of the serialized product  

Prerequisite Customizing. 

Step 1: To define the custom attribute (Z_PRODUCT) into the Service team.​ 

Z_PRODUCT is assigned in the custom Responsibility Definition Name.​  

SAP Customizing Implementation Guide -> Cross-Application Components -> General Application Functions -> Responsibility Management -> Responsibility Definitions -> Define Custom Responsibility Definitions

 Step 2: Assigning custom attributes to the Team Category Service. 

SAP Customizing Implementation Guide -> Cross-Application Components -> General Application Functions -> Responsibility Management -> Teams and Responsibilities -> Team Categories -> Assign Custom Responsibility Definitions to Team Category

Step 3. Build a service team determination rule with attribute Z_PRODUCT and Source BADI​ 

  • Add Attribute Z_PRODUCT with source BADI.  

SAP Customizing Implementation Guide -> Service -> Master Data -> Service Teams -> Define Service Team Determination Rules 

Step 4: Register the event of SERVICE_OS to CRMS4_SRVTEAM_DETERM_REG_EC.​  

Step 5:  Implement the required logic within the BAdI.

SAP Customizing Implementation Guide -> Service -> Master Data -> Service Teams -> BAdI: Determine Service Team from Attributes

 

BAdI Definition Name: CRMS4_RM_SRVTEAM_DETERMINATION  
BAdI Interface: IF_CRMS4_RM_SRVTEAM_DET  
Method: IS_RELEVANT_FOR_DETERMINATION, READ_ATTRIBUTE_VALUE 

Example implementation is present in the BAdI definition CRMS4_RM_SRVTEAM_DETERMINATION. 

Example implementation class name: CL_CRMS4_SRVTEAM_DET_EXAMPLE 

Step 6. Create a service order. Once the main reference object is entered, the service team will be determined. 

Example:

Let us consider enhancing the service team with custom attributes ‘Y_PRODUCT’. 

Create a Service Team and maintain value 'S01_FG126' for the attribute Y_PRODUCT. 

 

This product is assigned to the equipment (10000069)

Equipment has this product configured 

 

Create a Service Order and enter the equipment 10000069 as the main reference object 

 

Here the Service team (SERVICE_MS) assigned to this product is displayed and can be selected. If there are no Service team, then there will be no pop-up. 

Note: We also see another Service team “SERVICE_NG” which is common service team for all products and no value is assigned to Y_PRODUCT attribute in this service team
